a1f54582-6963-44c2-96ff-068c5731caeb.description: Earners of this award will have demonstrated high academic achievement during the semester for which it is awarded. Students bestowed with this distinction have a major field of study in the School of Arts and Sciences and have achieved a minimum semester grade point average that represents superior performance in their courses. It is recorded on a student’s official academic transcript for each term awarded.
a1f54582-6963-44c2-96ff-068c5731caeb.name: Deans List, School of Arts and Sciences, Spring 2020

badge_template_activities.title: Any full time student who completes all courses for which they registered, which are graded using the normal grading system (A through F) and achieves a 3.50 grade point average will be included on the Dean’s List.*

Any part time student enrolled for at least 8 credits, who completes all courses for which they are registered, which are graded using the normal grading system (A through F), and achieves at least a 3.50 grade point average will be included on the Dean’s List.*

*Due to the Covid crisis, for the Spring 2020 semester the requirements that students complete all courses for which they registered and that these courses be graded using the normal grading system were waived.

942951b9-fd78-4abf-82d7-d808ff36c97a.description: Earners will be able to identify personality traits, assess personality, and understand personality disorders. They will recognize symptoms of mental illness and identify potential diagnoses using current major systems. Earners will be able to evaluate various psycho-therapeutic approaches and consider issues of diversity in studying personality, identifying abnormality, and providing therapy. Earners will be able to conduct interviews and provide preliminary assessments for intervention.
942951b9-fd78-4abf-82d7-d808ff36c97a.name: Foundational Counseling Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete PY  3311, Theories of Personality, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PY 3310, Abnormal Human Behavior, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PY 4320, Counseling Psychology, with a grade of B or better.

In addition to the courses required for the Micro-Credential, earners will have taken PY 2010, Introduction to Psychology, and PY 3010, Research, Design, and Analysis to satisfy the prerequisite requirements of the required courses.

f7f88412-09c8-4c53-9c72-8fc272c4747e.description: Earners of this award will have demonstrated high academic achievement during the semester for which it is awarded. Students bestowed with this distinction have a major field of study in the School of Professional Studies and have achieved a minimum semester grade point average that represents superior performance in their courses. It is recorded on a student’s official academic transcript for each term awarded.
f7f88412-09c8-4c53-9c72-8fc272c4747e.name: Dean's List, School of Professional Studies, Spring 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Any full time student who completes all courses for which they registered, which are graded using the normal grading system (A through F) and achieves a 3.50 grade point average will be included on the Dean’s List.

Any part time student enrolled for at least 8 credits, who completes all courses for which they are registered, which are graded using the normal grading system (A through F), and achieves at least a 3.50 grade point average will be included on the Dean’s List.

93e96b73-cb1e-4524-9f0e-2a86c687a5eb.description: Earners of this Micro-Credential have demonstrated a broad and deep knowledge of business taxation principles, theories, and practice. Earners are able to develop solutions to complex issues utilizing critical thinking skills, and are prepared to become socially responsible business leaders able to recognize ethical dilemmas and achieve resolutions in a professionally responsible manner. They understand the role of taxation in business and society and communicate this knowledge effectively.
93e96b73-cb1e-4524-9f0e-2a86c687a5eb.name: Business Taxation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete BU 7570, Tax for Corporate Managers, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete BU 7572 Taxation of S Corps, Partnerships, and LLCs, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete BU 7575 Taxation of Reorganizations & Liquidations, with a grade of B or better.

f4ab3f95-82ec-4b87-a2ff-95d158e857d6.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential have demonstrated a broad and deep knowledge of estate, gift, and trust taxation principles, theories, and practice. Earners are able to develop solutions to complex issues utilizing analytical skills, and are prepared to become socially aware business leaders able to recognize ethical dilemmas and achieve resolutions in a professionally responsible manner. They understand the role of taxation in business and society and communicate this knowledge effectively.
f4ab3f95-82ec-4b87-a2ff-95d158e857d6.name: Estate, Gift & Trust Taxation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete BU 7574, Estate & Gift Taxation, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete BU 7581, Taxation of Estates & Trusts, with a grade of B or better.

27cf2b43-6924-4dd1-ba15-e04f26ba2556.description: Earners of this Micro-Credential have demonstrated broad knowledge of fraud/forensic accounting principles, theories, and practice. Earners are able to develop solutions to issues utilizing critical thinking skills and are prepared to become socially responsible business leaders able to recognize ethical dilemmas and achieve resolutions in a professionally responsible manner. They understand the role of fraud/forensic accounting in business and society and communicate this knowledge effectively.
27cf2b43-6924-4dd1-ba15-e04f26ba2556.name: Foundations of Forensic Accounting

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete BU 7560, Fraud Examination, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete BU 7555, Accounting Information Systems, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete BU 7561, Case Studies in Forensic Accounting, with a grade of B or better.

66478c27-6e4d-44f0-b13a-cb3d71bcd8e4.description: Earners of this Micro-Credential will have demonstrated a knowledge of the basic skills needed to help manage a nonprofit organization's operations, finances and planning. Earners will understand the management, governance, and financial issues nonprofit leaders face, and the managerial, financial, and communications skills needed to handle them. They will be familiar with the role and structure of the nonprofit sector, and how nonprofit leaders contribute to public policy-making.
66478c27-6e4d-44f0-b13a-cb3d71bcd8e4.name: Foundations of Nonprofit Management

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete PS 3625, Nonprofit Stewardship, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PS 4630, Financial Administration of Nonprofits, with a grade of B or better.

c4257de6-e54a-4047-9842-602d0fdd851b.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential will have demonstrated advanced skills for creating high production value television programs and videos. Earners employ sophisticated documentary and TV production and post-production techniques to create professional level TV/Video projects and create demo reels/web portfolios highlighting skills and creative work. Students successfully completing the requirements of the Micro- Credential will leave with an online portfolio showcasing short video or TV segments.
c4257de6-e54a-4047-9842-602d0fdd851b.name: Advanced TV/Video Production

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete one of three courses: AS 4965, Video In Action; AS 4935, TV In Action; or AS 9000 Senior Media Fellow, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete AS 5725, Senior Media Portfolio, with a grade of B or better.

In addition to the courses required for the Micro-Credential, earners will have taken AS2802, Multimedia Journalism; plus AS 3247, Introduction to Video and TV, and AS 4852, Advanced Video: Documentary; or AS 4870, Advanced TV: Studio Production, to satisfy the prerequisite requirements of the required courses.

8d1a0716-5ff2-47ba-a116-4974a5c03753.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential will have demonstrated a basic knowledge of how economic enterprises manage their internal operations and market the goods or services they offer. Its courses focus on the applicability of theoretical knowledge to practical situations encountered in the workplace to help students preparing to enter the workforce and workers needing to upgrade their skills secure and succeed in positions in the emerging economy.
8d1a0716-5ff2-47ba-a116-4974a5c03753.name: Professional Skills for the Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete PS 3330, Professional Supervision, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PS 3430, Marketing for Professionals, with a grade of B or better.

e3a49afa-83f4-4b2c-8a08-6edc3e29bbcf.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential will have demonstrated basic theoretical and practical knowledge of information technology and business communications: how to acquire, analyze, and utilize information, and how to communicate effectively with management, peers, and customers. Students entering the workforce or workers upgrading their skills who complete the Micro-Credential will be equipped to contribute useful insights and operational capabilities to the enterprises that employ them.
e3a49afa-83f4-4b2c-8a08-6edc3e29bbcf.name: Workplace Communication and Information Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete PS 3230, Professional Communication, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PS 3260, Information Technology for Professionals, with a grade of B or better.

ab903423-2bd7-431b-89ab-34ed3caf6876.description: Earners will have demonstrated foundational knowledge of behavioral learning principles, methodologies, and procedures, and how they may be applied to address problematic behaviors and effect adaptive behavior change. They will thus have the foundations for careers in fields such as behavior therapy, counseling, mental health counseling, clinical psychology, social work, behavioral health, sports psychology, special education, applied behavior analysis, and basic or applied behavioral research.
ab903423-2bd7-431b-89ab-34ed3caf6876.name: Foundations in Applied Behavior Change

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will have completed PY 3420, Learning and Motivation, with a grade of B or better.
Earners will have completed PY 4330, Behavior Modification, with a grade of B or better.
Earners will have completed PY 4401, Developmental Neuropathology, with a grade of B or better.

In addition to the courses required for the Microcredential, earners will have taken PY 2010, Introduction to Psychology, and PY 3010, Research, Design, and Analysis to satisfy the prerequisite requirements of the required courses.

skills.name: Application of Behavioral Learning to address Problematic Behaviors
Application of Behavioral Learning to effect Adaptive Behavior Change

b8e3d9db-a0c8-44e6-a540-c391a5497b25.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential will have demonstrated an understanding of the anatomy and physiology of the central nervous system and the molecular and biochemical basis of cognitive higher-order cortical information processing. Additionally, they will have a specialized focus on the cognitive processing of neuropsychiatric and developmental disorders, brain injuries, and age-related changes in cognition. They will also understand neuropsychological testing.
b8e3d9db-a0c8-44e6-a540-c391a5497b25.name: Foundations of Cognitive Neuropsychology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete PY 3410, Cognitive Psychology, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PY 4401, Developmental Neuropathology, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PY 4403, Cognitive Neuroscience, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PY 4610, Clinical Neuropsychology, with a grade of B or better.

In addition to the courses required for the Micro-Credential, earners will have taken PY 2010, Introduction to Psychology, and PY 3010, Research, Design, and Analysis-I to satisfy the prerequisite requirements for the required courses.

1e6e6d57-f41f-4198-96bf-83a138b38dce.description: Earners will have demonstrated foundational skills in creative writing in several genres such as short fiction, creative non-fiction, drama, and poetry. Through textual analysis, writing, and editing in workshop-based classes, earners will have honed their craft as creative writers and prepared for professional fields such as writing, publishing, marketing, and editing. They will have expressed their diverse experiences and identities and learned the value of their unique, powerful voices.
1e6e6d57-f41f-4198-96bf-83a138b38dce.name: Foundations of Creative Writing

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete EL 3901, Introduction to Creative Writing, with a grade of B or better.

Earners must complete two of the following with a grade of B or better: EL 3920, The Art of Writing Poetry; EL 3950, Creative Nonfiction; EL 4100, English Internship (Harmonia Editorial Board); or EL 4520, Reading and Writing the Short Story.

6c2a1f14-c52a-47dd-a932-3deb043836d1.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential will have demonstrated understanding of the anatomy and physiology of the central nervous system, and the molecular and biochemical basis of neurotransmitter signaling across brain regions. Further, they will have a specialized knowledge of neuropharmacology, affinity, efficacy, tolerance, along with instrumental medication drug treatment and recreational drug use and abuse, and an understanding of the biological basis of psychological and psychiatric disorders.
6c2a1f14-c52a-47dd-a932-3deb043836d1.name: Foundations of Neuropsychopharmacology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete PY 3610, Brain and Behavior, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PY 3620, Drugs and Behavior, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PY 4402, Neuropsychopharmacology, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete PY 4610, Clinical Neuropsychology, with a grade of B or better.

In addition to the courses required for the Micro-Credential, earners will have taken PY 2010, Introduction to Psychology, and PY 3010, Research, Design, and Analysis-I to satisfy the prerequisite requirements for the required courses.

6f4fa0f6-df5b-494a-88db-e77909d0a0f9.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential will have demonstrated basic skills for translating documents of a professional nature from English into Spanish. Earners learn advanced Spanish language skills; the morphological and syntactical differences between English and Spanish; translation theories and methods; key source texts to develop translations; and the ethics, processes, and work expectations of professional translation. They will be able to complete professional level translations.
6f4fa0f6-df5b-494a-88db-e77909d0a0f9.name: Foundations of Spanish Translation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete ML 2110, Intermediate Spanish II, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete ML 3362, Advanced Spanish Grammar and Composition, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete ML 3200, Translation Workshop, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete ML 4201, Seminar in Translation Techniques, with a grade of B or better.

skills.name: Grammatical Differences Between English And Spanish

c18224cf-5333-4cc4-a6de-b533e25b1e11.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential will have demonstrated basic video production and post-production skills for documentary reporting or advocacy, including researching, storyboarding, scriptwriting, basic cinematography, sound recording, and non-linear editing. They will have demonstrated the ability to use portable and studio equipment to produce original video works, and an understanding of the history, ethics, elements, and language of documentary media and socially responsible journalism.
c18224cf-5333-4cc4-a6de-b533e25b1e11.name: Fundamentals of Non-Fiction Video Production

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete AS 3247 Introduction to Video and TV with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete AS 4852, Advanced Video: Documentary, with a grade of B or better.
In addition to the courses required for the Micro-Credential, earners will have taken AS2802, Multimedia Journalism to satisfy the prerequisite requirements of the required courses.

ac04c022-de3a-404d-9e34-4293f0de1c93.description: Earners of the Micro-Credential will have demonstrated the foundational skills of field-video and studio television production for news reporting, including pre-production, field and studio camera operation, sound recording, using switchers and prompters, and graphics and advanced non-linear editing. Earners gain a knowledge of live/live-to-tape studio production workflows and responsible journalism practices, and the ability to collaboratively produce news segments in the field and the studio.
ac04c022-de3a-404d-9e34-4293f0de1c93.name: Fundamentals of Television News Production

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete AS 3247, Introduction to Video and TV, with a grade of B or better.
Earners must complete AS 4870, Advanced TV: Studio Production, with a grade of B or better.
In addition to the courses required for the Micro-Credential, earners will have taken AS2802, Multimedia Journalism to satisfy the prerequisite requirements of the required courses.
